definitions.definition: The result of no longer possessing an object, a function, or a characteristic due to external causes or misplacement.
definitions.example: In other areas, glacier loss creates serious risk of a dry period across the Third Pole, Wang said.

definitions.definition: The destruction or ruin of an object.
Something that has been destroyed or ruined.
definitions.example: It was a terrible crash; both cars were total losses.

definitions.definition: Defeat; an instance of being defeated.
definitions.example: The match ended in their first loss of the season.

definitions.definition: The death of a person or animal.
definitions.example: The battle was won, but losses were great.

definitions.definition: The condition of grief caused by losing someone or something, especially someone who has died.
definitions.example: Her daughter's sense of loss eventually led to depression.

definitions.definition: (financial) The sum an entity loses on balance.
definitions.example: The sum of expenditures and taxes minus total income is a loss, when this difference is positive.

definitions.definition: Electricity of kinetic power expended without doing useful work.
definitions.example: The inefficiency of many old-fashioned power plants exceeds 60% loss before the subsequent losses during transport over the grid.
